data: PED ENDO Non Diabetes Related Hypoglycemia for Ages Greater than 10 Years (Module)
Status

This powerplan applies to children greater than 10 years of age who do NOT have diabetes mellitus and who have a blood sugar between 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L with hypoglycemia symptoms). If patient IS diabetic refer to PED ENDO Hypoglcemia for Patients with Diabetes Mellitus (Module)
Refer to Pediatric Hypoglycemia Management Algorithm for Patients WITHOUT Diabetes- ADD LINK
Communication Order
If patient has a POC Glucose Whole Blood reading less than 4 mmol/L, refer to Pediatric Hypoglycemia Management Algorithm for Patients WITHOUT Diabetes for all treatments
Patient Care
Insert Peripheral IV (Intravenous) Catheter
T;N
POC Glucose Whole Blood
Before every feed/meal
Before every second feed/meal
q3h
q6h
Notify Treating Provider
Notify provider if Patient:  1.Cannot tolerate oral glucose/feed  2.Or unconscious and/or seizing  3.Or POC Glucose Whole Blood is less than 3 mmol/L   4.Or if NPO
POC Glucose Whole Blood
Re-check blood glucose 2 hours post hypoglycemia treatment, to ensure it remains greater than 3.5 mmol/L
Diet/Nutrition
STEP 1: For patients greater than 10 years of age with blood sugar of 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L) with hypoglycemia symptoms
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions
If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 1 is between 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L with symptoms) give oral feed as ordered by provider.  Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 30 minutes
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia), if repeat blood glucose less than 3 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions

If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 2 is less then 3 mmol/L following step 1 management. Notify provider and administer 16g of fast acting carbohydrate. Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 15 minutes.  Notify provider with result
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia), if repeat blood glucose 3 to 3.5 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions

If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 2 is 3 to 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, administer 16 g fast acting carbohydrate. Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 15 minutes. Notify provider with result
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of 3 to 3.5 mmol/L (or 3.5 to 4 mmol/L with symptoms of hypoglycemia), if repeat blood glucose greater than 3.5 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions
If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 2 is greater than or equal to 3.5 mmol/L after Step 1 management, recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 30 minute. Notify provider if result is less than 3.5 mmol/L
STEP 1: For patients greater than 10 years of age with blood sugar less than 3 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions
If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 1 is less than 3 mmol/L administer 16 g of fast acting carbohydrate. Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 15 minutes
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of less than 3 mmol/L, if repeat blood glucose less than 3 mmol/L again
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions

If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 2 is less than 3 mmol/L following step 1 management administer 16 g of fast acting carbohydrate. Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 15 minutes. Notify provider with result
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of less than 3 mmol/L, if repeat blood glucose between 3 to 3.5 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions

If POC Glucose number 2 is between 3 to 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, administer 16 g fast acting carbohydrate. Recheck POC Glucose in 30 minute. Notify provider if result is less than 3.5 mmol/L. If 3.5 mmol/L or greater proceed with oral feed
STEP 2: After initial blood sugar of less than 3 mmol/L, if repeat blood glucose greater than 3.5 mmol/L
Hypoglycemia Management Instructions

If POC Glucose Whole Blood number 2 is greater than 3.5 mmol/L following step 1 management, give oral feed as ordered as provider.  Recheck POC Glucose Whole Blood in 30 minutes. Notify provider if repeat is less than 3.5 mmol/L
